### API

<Fragment set:html={`
<dl class="py class">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.ARC4Contract">
<em class="property"><span class="pre">class</span><span class="w"> </span></em><span class="sig-prename descclassname"><span class="pre">algopy.</span></span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">ARC4Contract</span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.ARC4Contract" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>A contract that conforms to the ARC4 ABI specification, functions decorated with
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">@abimethod</span></code> or <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">@baremethod</span></code> will form the public interface of the contract</p>
<p>The approval_program will be implemented by the compiler, and route application args
according to the ARC4 ABI specification</p>
<p>The clear_state_program will by default return True, but can be overridden</p>
<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.ARC4Contract.__init_subclass__">

<span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.ARC4Contract.__init_subclass__" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>When declaring a Contract subclass, options and configuration are passed in
the base class list:</p>
`} /><Code code={`<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="k">class</span> <span class="nc">MyContract</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">algopy</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Contract</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s2">"CustomName"</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="o">...</span>
</pre></div>
</div>`} lang='py' frame='none' /><Fragment set:html={`
<dl class="myst field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>name</strong> – </p><p>Will affect the output TEAL file name if there are multiple non-abstract contracts
in the same file.</p>
<p>If the contract is a subclass of algopy.ARC4Contract, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">name</span></code> will also be used as the
contract name in the ARC-32 application.json, instead of the class name.</p>
<p></p></li>
<li><p><strong>scratch_slots</strong> – </p><p>Allows you to mark a slot ID or range of slot IDs as “off limits” to Puya.
These slot ID(s) will never be written to or otherwise manipulating by the compiler itself.
This is particularly useful in combination with <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">algopy.op.gload_bytes</span></code> / <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">algopy.op.gload_uint64</span></code>
which lets a contract in a group transaction read from the scratch slots of another contract
that occurs earlier in the transaction group.</p>
<p>In the case of inheritance, scratch slots reserved become cumulative. It is not an error
to have overlapping ranges or values either, so if a base class contract reserves slots
0-5 inclusive and the derived contract reserves 5-10 inclusive, then within the derived
contract all slots 0-10 will be marked as reserved.</p>
<p></p></li>
<li><p><strong>state_totals</strong> – </p><p>Allows defining what values should be used for global and local uint and bytes storage
values when creating a contract. Used when outputting ARC-32 application.json schemas.</p>
<p>If let unspecified, the totals will be determined by the compiler based on state
variables assigned to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">self</span></code>.</p>
<p>This setting is not inherited, and only applies to the exact <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Contract</span></code> it is specified
on. If a base class does specify this setting, and a derived class does not, a warning
will be emitted for the derived class. To resolve this warning, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">state_totals</span></code> must be
specified. Note that it is valid to not provide any arguments to the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">StateTotals</span></code>
constructor, like so <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">state_totals=StateTotals()</span></code>, in which case all values will be
automatically calculated.</p>
<p></p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.ARC4Contract.approval_program">

where <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">OnCompletion</span></code> != <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ClearState</span></code></p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.ARC4Contract.clear_state_program">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">clear_state_program</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span> <span class="sig-return"><span class="sig-return-icon">→</span> <span class="sig-return-typehint"><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.UInt64" title="algopy.UInt64"><span class="pre">algopy.UInt64</span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">|</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">bool</span></a></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.ARC4Contract.clear_state_program" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>

</dd></dl>

<dl class="py class">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.Account">
<em class="property"><span class="pre">class</span><span class="w"> </span></em><span class="sig-prename descclassname"><span class="pre">algopy.</span></span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">Account</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">value</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">str</span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">|</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.Bytes" title="algopy.Bytes"><span class="pre">algopy.Bytes</span></a></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">...</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">/</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.Account" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>An Account on the Algorand network.</p>
<p>Note: must be an available resource to access properties other than <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">bytes</span></code></p>
<p class="rubric">Initialization</p>
<p>If <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">value</span></code> is a string, it should be a 58 character base32 string,
ie a base32 string-encoded 32 bytes public key + 4 bytes checksum.
If <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">value</span></code> is a Bytes, it’s length checked to be 32 bytes - to avoid this
check, use <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Address.from_bytes(...)</span></code> instead.
Defaults to the zero-address.</p>
<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.Account.__bool__">

<dl class="py class">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.BigUInt">
<em class="property"><span class="pre">class</span><span class="w"> </span></em><span class="sig-prename descclassname"><span class="pre">algopy.</span></span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">BigUInt</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">value</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.UInt64" title="algopy.UInt64"><span class="pre">algopy.UInt64</span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">|</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">int</span></a></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">0</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">/</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.BigUInt" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>A variable length (max 512-bit) unsigned integer</p>
<p class="rubric">Initialization</p>
<p>A BigUInt can be initialized with a UInt64, a Python int literal, or an int variable
declared at the module level</p>
<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.BigUInt.__add__">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">__add__</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">other</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.BigUInt" title="algopy.BigUInt"><span class="pre">algopy.BigUInt</span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">|</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.UInt64" title="algopy.UInt64"><span class="pre">algopy.UInt64</span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">|</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">int</span></a></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span> <span class="sig-return"><span class="sig-return-icon">→</span> <span class="sig-return-typehint"><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.BigUInt" title="algopy.BigUInt"><span class="pre">algopy.BigUInt</span></a></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.BigUInt.__add__" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>A BigUInt can be added with another BigUInt, UInt64 or int e.g. <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">BigUInt(4)</span> <span class="pre">+</span> <span class="pre">2</span></code>.</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.BigUInt.__and__">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">__and__</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">other</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.BigUInt" title="algopy.BigUInt"><span class="pre">algopy.BigUInt</span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">|</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.UInt64" title="algopy.UInt64"><span class="pre">algopy.UInt64</span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">|</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">int</span></a></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span> <span class="sig-return"><span class="sig-return-icon">→</span> <span class="sig-return-typehint"><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.BigUInt" title="algopy.BigUInt"><span class="pre">algopy.BigUInt</span></a></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.BigUInt.__and__" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>A BigUInt can bitwise and with another BigUInt, UInt64 or int e.g. <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">BigUInt(4)</span> <span class="pre">&amp;</span> <span class="pre">2</span></code></p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.BigUInt.__bool__">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">__bool__</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span> <span class="sig-return"><span class="sig-return-icon">→</span> <span class="sig-return-typehint"><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">bool</span></a></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.BigUInt.__bool__" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>A BigUInt will evaluate to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">False</span></code> if zero, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">True</span></code> otherwise</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py class">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.Box">
<em class="property"><span class="pre">class</span><span class="w"> </span></em><span class="sig-prename descclassname"><span class="pre">algopy.</span></span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">Box</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span>

<dl>
<dd><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">type_</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#type" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">type</span></a><span class="p"><span class="pre">[</span></span><span class="pre">algopy._TValue</span><span class="p"><span class="pre">]</span></span></span></em>,</dd>
<dd><em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">/</span></span></em>,</dd>
<dd><em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">*</span></span></em>,</dd>
<dd><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">key</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#bytes" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">bytes</span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">|</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">str</span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">|</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.Bytes" title="algopy.Bytes"><span class="pre">algopy.Bytes</span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">|</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.String" title="algopy.String"><span class="pre">algopy.String</span></a></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">...</span></span></em>,</dd>
</dl>

<span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.Box" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Box abstracts the reading and writing of a single value to a single box.
The box size will be reconfigured dynamically to fit the size of the value being assigned to
it.</p>
<p class="rubric">Initialization</p>
<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.Box.__bool__">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">__bool__</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span> <span class="sig-return"><span class="sig-return-icon">→</span> <span class="sig-return-typehint"><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">bool</span></a></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.Box.__bool__" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Returns True if the box exists, regardless of the truthiness of the contents
of the box</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py class">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.BoxMap">
<em class="property"><span class="pre">class</span><span class="w"> </span></em><span class="sig-prename descclassname"><span class="pre">algopy.</span></span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">BoxMap</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span>

<dl>
<dd><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">key_type</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#type" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">type</span></a><span class="p"><span class="pre">[</span></span><span class="pre">algopy._TKey</span><span class="p"><span class="pre">]</span></span></span></em>,</dd>
<dd><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">value_type</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#type" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">type</span></a><span class="p"><span class="pre">[</span></span><span class="pre">algopy._TValue</span><span class="p"><span class="pre">]</span></span></span></em>,</dd>
<dd><em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">/</span></span></em>,</dd>
<dd><em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">*</span></span></em>,</dd>
<dd><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">key_prefix</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#bytes" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">bytes</span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">|</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">str</span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">|</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.Bytes" title="algopy.Bytes"><span class="pre">algopy.Bytes</span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">|</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.String" title="algopy.String"><span class="pre">algopy.String</span></a></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">...</span></span></em>,</dd>
</dl>

<span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.BoxMap" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>BoxMap abstracts the reading and writing of a set of boxes using a common key and content type.
Each composite key (prefix + key) still needs to be made available to the application via the
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">boxes</span></code> property of the Transaction.</p>
<p class="rubric">Initialization</p>
<p>Declare a box map.</p>
<dl class="myst field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>key_type</strong> – The type of the keys</p></li>
<li><p><strong>value_type</strong> – The type of the values</p></li>
<li><p><strong>key_prefix</strong> – The value used as a prefix to key data, can be empty.
When the BoxMap is being assigned to a member variable,
this argument is optional and defaults to the member variable name,
and if a custom value is supplied it must be static.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.BoxMap.__contains__">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">__contains__</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">key</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><span class="pre">algopy._TKey</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span> <span class="sig-return"><span class="sig-return-icon">→</span> <span class="sig-return-typehint"><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">bool</span></a></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.BoxMap.__contains__" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Returns True if a box with the specified key exists in the map, regardless of the
truthiness of the contents of the box</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py class">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.BoxRef">
<em class="property"><span class="pre">class</span><span class="w"> </span></em><span class="sig-prename descclassname"><span class="pre">algopy.</span></span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">BoxRef</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">/</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">*</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">key:</span> <span class="pre">bytes</span> <span class="pre">|</span> <span class="pre">str</span> <span class="pre">|</span> <span class="pre">algopy.Bytes</span> <span class="pre">|</span> <span class="pre">algopy.String</span> <span class="pre">=</span> <span class="pre">...</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.BoxRef" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>BoxRef abstracts the reading and writing of boxes containing raw binary data. The size is
configured manually, and can be set to values larger than what the AVM can handle in a single
value.</p>
<p class="rubric">Initialization</p>
<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.BoxRef.__bool__">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">__bool__</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span> <span class="sig-return"><span class="sig-return-icon">→</span> <span class="sig-return-typehint"><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">bool</span></a></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.BoxRef.__bool__" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Returns True if the box has a value set, regardless of the truthiness of that value</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.BoxRef.create">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">create</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">*</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">size</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.UInt64" title="algopy.UInt64"><span class="pre">algopy.UInt64</span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">|</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">int</span></a></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span> <span class="sig-return"><span class="sig-return-icon">→</span> <span class="sig-return-typehint"><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">bool</span></a></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.BoxRef.create" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Creates a box with the specified size, setting all bits to zero. Fails if the box already
exists with a different size. Fails if the specified size is greater than the max box size
(32,768)</p>
<p>Returns True if the box was created, False if the box already existed</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.BoxRef.put">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">put</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">value</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.Bytes" title="algopy.Bytes"><span class="pre">algopy.Bytes</span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">|</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#bytes" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">bytes</span></a></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span> <span class="sig-return"><span class="sig-return-icon">→</span> <span class="sig-return-typehint"><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/constants.html#None" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">None</span></a></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.BoxRef.put" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Replaces the contents of box with value. Fails if box exists and len(box) != len(value).
Creates box if it does not exist</p>
<dl class="myst field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><strong>value</strong> – The value to write to the box</p>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.BoxRef.replace">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">replace</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">start_index</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.UInt64" title="algopy.UInt64"><span class="pre">algopy.UInt64</span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">|</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">int</span></a></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">value</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.Bytes" title="algopy.Bytes"><span class="pre">algopy.Bytes</span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">|</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#bytes" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">bytes</span></a></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span> <span class="sig-return"><span class="sig-return-icon">→</span> <span class="sig-return-typehint"><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/constants.html#None" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">None</span></a></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.BoxRef.replace" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Write <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">value</span></code> to the box starting at <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">start_index</span></code>. Fails if the box does not exist,
or if <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">start_index</span> <span class="pre">+</span> <span class="pre">len(value)</span> <span class="pre">&gt;</span> <span class="pre">len(box)</span></code></p>
<dl class="myst field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>start_index</strong> – The offset to start writing bytes from</p></li>
<li><p><strong>value</strong> – The bytes to be written</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.BoxRef.resize">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">resize</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">new_size</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.UInt64" title="algopy.UInt64"><span class="pre">algopy.UInt64</span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">|</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">int</span></a></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span> <span class="sig-return"><span class="sig-return-icon">→</span> <span class="sig-return-typehint"><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/constants.html#None" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">None</span></a></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.BoxRef.resize" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Resizes the box the specified <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">new_size</span></code>. Truncating existing data if the new value is
shorter or padding with zero bytes if it is longer.</p>
<dl class="myst field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><strong>new_size</strong> – The new size of the box</p>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.BoxRef.splice">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">splice</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span>

<dl>
<dd><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">start_index</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.UInt64" title="algopy.UInt64"><span class="pre">algopy.UInt64</span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">|</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">int</span></a></span></em>,</dd>
<dd><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">length</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.UInt64" title="algopy.UInt64"><span class="pre">algopy.UInt64</span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">|</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">int</span></a></span></em>,</dd>
<dd><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">value</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.Bytes" title="algopy.Bytes"><span class="pre">algopy.Bytes</span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">|</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#bytes" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">bytes</span></a></span></em>,</dd>
</dl>

<span class="sig-paren">)</span> <span class="sig-return"><span class="sig-return-icon">→</span> <span class="sig-return-typehint"><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/constants.html#None" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">None</span></a></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.BoxRef.splice" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>set box to contain its previous bytes up to index <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">start_index</span></code>, followed by <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">bytes</span></code>,
followed by the original bytes of the box that began at index <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">start_index</span> <span class="pre">+</span> <span class="pre">length</span></code></p>
<p><strong>Important: This op does not resize the box</strong>
If the new value is longer than the box size, it will be truncated.
If the new value is shorter than the box size, it will be padded with zero bytes</p>
<dl class="myst field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>start_index</strong> – The index to start inserting <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">value</span></code></p></li>
<li><p><strong>length</strong> – The number of bytes after <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">start_index</span></code> to omit from the new value</p></li>
<li><p><strong>value</strong> – The <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">value</span></code> to be inserted.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd></dl>

</dd></dl>

<dl class="py class">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.Bytes">
<em class="property"><span class="pre">class</span><span class="w"> </span></em><span class="sig-prename descclassname"><span class="pre">algopy.</span></span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">Bytes</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">value</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#bytes" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">bytes</span></a></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">b''</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">/</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.Bytes" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>A byte sequence, with a maximum length of 4096 bytes, one of the primary data types on the AVM</p>
<p class="rubric">Initialization</p>
<p>Bytes can be initialized with a Python bytes literal, or bytes variable
declared at the module level</p>

class="pre">int</span></a><span class="w"> </span><span class="p"><span class="pre">|</span></span><span class="w"> </span><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.urange" title="algopy.urange"><span class="pre">algopy.urange</span></a><span class="p"><span class="pre">]</span></span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">...</span></span></em>,</dd>
<dd><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">state_totals</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference internal" href="#algopy.StateTotals" title="algopy.StateTotals"><span class="pre">algopy.StateTotals</span></a></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">...</span></span></em>,</dd>
</dl>

<span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.Contract.__init_subclass__" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>When declaring a Contract subclass, options and configuration are passed in
the base class list:</p>
`} /><Code code={`<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="k">class</span> <span class="nc">MyContract</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">algopy</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Contract</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s2">"CustomName"</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="o">...</span>
</pre></div>
</div>`} lang='py' frame='none' /><Fragment set:html={`
<dl class="myst field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters<span class="colon">:</span></dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>name</strong> – </p><p>Will affect the output TEAL file name if there are multiple non-abstract contracts
in the same file.</p>
<p>If the contract is a subclass of algopy.ARC4Contract, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">name</span></code> will also be used as the
contract name in the ARC-32 application.json, instead of the class name.</p>
<p></p></li>
<li><p><strong>scratch_slots</strong> – </p><p>Allows you to mark a slot ID or range of slot IDs as “off limits” to Puya.
These slot ID(s) will never be written to or otherwise manipulating by the compiler itself.
This is particularly useful in combination with <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">algopy.op.gload_bytes</span></code> / <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">algopy.op.gload_uint64</span></code>
which lets a contract in a group transaction read from the scratch slots of another contract
that occurs earlier in the transaction group.</p>
<p>In the case of inheritance, scratch slots reserved become cumulative. It is not an error
to have overlapping ranges or values either, so if a base class contract reserves slots
0-5 inclusive and the derived contract reserves 5-10 inclusive, then within the derived
contract all slots 0-10 will be marked as reserved.</p>
<p></p></li>
<li><p><strong>state_totals</strong> – </p><p>Allows defining what values should be used for global and local uint and bytes storage
values when creating a contract. Used when outputting ARC-32 application.json schemas.</p>
<p>If let unspecified, the totals will be determined by the compiler based on state
variables assigned to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">self</span></code>.</p>
<p>This setting is not inherited, and only applies to the exact <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Contract</span></code> it is specified
on. If a base class does specify this setting, and a derived class does not, a warning
will be emitted for the derived class. To resolve this warning, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">state_totals</span></code> must be
specified. Note that it is valid to not provide any arguments to the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">StateTotals</span></code>
constructor, like so <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">state_totals=StateTotals()</span></code>, in which case all values will be
automatically calculated.</p>
<p></p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py class">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.GlobalState">
<em class="property"><span class="pre">class</span><span class="w"> </span></em><span class="sig-prename descclassname"><span class="pre">algopy.</span></span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">GlobalState</span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.GlobalState" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Global state associated with the application, the key will be the name of the member, this
is assigned to</p>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
<p>The <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">GlobalState</span></code> class provides a richer API that in addition to storing and retrieving
values, can test if a value is set or unset it. However if this extra functionality is not
needed then it is simpler to just store the data without the GlobalState proxy
e.g. <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">self.some_variable</span> <span class="pre">=</span> <span class="pre">UInt64(0)</span></code></p>
</div>
<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="algopy.GlobalState.__bool__">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">__bool__</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span> <span class="sig-return"><span class="sig-return-icon">→</span> <span class="sig-return-typehint"><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.13)"><span class="pre">bool</span></a></span></span><a class="headerlink" href="#algopy.GlobalState.__bool__" title="Link to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Returns <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">True</span></code> if the key has a value set, regardless of the truthiness of that value</p>
</dd></dl>
